author: DavidMarkDC

text: Look forward to reading it, whenever it's out. Thirty years on, the race looks both prescient and archaic, in different ways.
author: DavidMarkDC

text: Plus, no real vetting, as nominees-in-waiting hire big law firms to perform. No idea if early running mate pick could have issues with old tax returns, other financials, personal issues, etc.
author: DavidMarkDC

text: For Trump, attacking McCain is a way to appeal to his political base
author: DavidMarkDC

text: Biden's Obama-style trade record puts him to the Right of Trump
author: DavidMarkDC

text:
Joe Biden tapping Stacey Abrams as early VP pick would be risky absent a serious vet by major law firm, looking at tax returns, financials, personal issues, etc.

That's not to allege ANYTHING about Abrams's past -- or any other early pick. Just political blocking/tackling.
author: DavidMarkDC

text: As a former two-term senator, Mike Gravel (D-Alaska) in 2008 won big-network interviews and debate spots. Eyeing a 2020 bid, at 88, unlikely to get the same treatment again. More of a Eugene McCarthy/Harold Stassen figure at this point, running repeatedly,
author: DavidMarkDC

text: White House ignores House panels’ requests for documents, Democrats say
author: DavidMarkDC

text:
Come for the celebration of open government and nationwide access to the view representatives' legislative actions in the People's House. 

Stay for the late 1970's-era three-piece suits!

text: Smart technique by @davidaxelrod interviewing @JebBush. Interview touched on, but didn't dwell over policy differences on education policy, tax cuts, etc. Created opening opening canvass for news-making -- JB thinks Trump should face GOP primary challenge.
author: DavidMarkDC

text:
High-risk, high-reward approach.

"Joaquin Castro 'All But Certain' to Challenge John Cornyn for U.S. Senate, Source Says"
author: DavidMarkDC

text:
Brilliant @ktumulty on worthiness and (ongoing) legacy of @cspan.

But much work to be done, no fault of the network. Including free-roaming cameras on House/Senate floors, and televised SCOTUS hearings. https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/happy-birthday-c-span-we-need-you-more-than-ever/2019/03/15/01bb7c9e-41d3-11e9-922c-64d6b7840b82_story.html?utm_term=.e65af36a74de … @HowardMortman
author: DavidMarkDC

text: U.S. ambassador to New Zealand is former Sen. Scott Brown, R-Mass. (who later ran in New Hampshire.) He figures to be a prominent face in the coming days of mourning and grieving, representing Trump administration.
author: DavidMarkDC

text: Smart, ahead-of-the-curve @MelissaQuinn97 story -- "White House officials have abandoned briefing room but now hold court on driveway"

text: And still a VP candidate in 1984, Geroge H.W. Bush.
